result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean D. Keegan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean D. Keegan

records.addlTxt: from DOC re: appears to be a typo on the sentencing for Ct#2, should be 8/29/2022
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

3:05 PM Defendant Dean D. Keegan in court.  Attorney Kevin Wade DeVore in court for Dean D. Keegan.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: amended information filed. Guilty to amended Ct#1 and Ct#2; 2 years probation: 60 days jail, stayed to be used at the agent's discretion, domestic violence assessment, court costs ($543) no contact with KJG, 3 days credit if probation is revoked. Atty DeVore and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guilty to amended Ct#1 and Ct#2.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to amended Ct#1 and ct#2. DA Hatch and Atty DeVore address sentencing. Victim's rights are in compliance. Court orders S/W 2 years probation; 60 days jail stayed to be used at the agent's discretion,  court costs ($543), no contact with KJG, domestic violence assessment and follow through , 3 days credit if probation is revoked. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 3:26
signed by Defendant and Atty DeVore
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
from Atty Devore to DA Hatch  w/ certificate of completion for one day anger management  group therapy program.
Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 11:08 am.

10:57 AM Defendant Dean D. Keegan appears in Court, Atty Kevin Wade DeVore, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Christopher Kober. S/T. DA Hatch questions Officer. Court reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty DeVore. DA Hatch redirect. DA Hatch: requests probable cause and bind DE over, Atty DeVore argues.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif
Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
signed by Defendant and Atty DeVore

3:12 PM Defendant Dean D. Keegan appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Shelly Tomtschik, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, or not to possess dangerous weapons & NC w/K.J.G. or her residene, no objection. Court so orders. DE does not qualify for PD, Clerk to send court appointed paperwork. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:22 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
